result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. ...
4)Defendant must submit to random alcohol testing within 3 hours of the request of the DA and pay all fees associated with testing.....
5)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
6)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
7) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick A. Wittig

records.addlTxt: 01:49 PM Defendant Derrick A. Wittig in court. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means. The VWC has had discussion with victim and we request resolution by DAGPA which has been signed and electronically filed.  Court advises defendant of disorderly conduct charge/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant pleads guilty, court defers plea for 2 years and approve the contract.  Mr. Wittig you need to report to the PCJ for fingerprints.
Proposed Order for Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:22 PM Defendant Derrick A. Wittig appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared in person for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and constitutional rights. No bond requested by the State as the victim has been in close contact with victim by the VWC.  Your next appearance Mr. Wittig is in person here in the courtroom unless Mr. Seifert doesn't think it is necessary.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  AIA scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

01:52 PM  A summons was issued for Mr. Wittig to come to court on 4/5.  On 4/5 Mr. Wittig appeared and was provided AIA for today at 1:30.  It is now 1:55, Mr. Wittig provides no reason for his non-appearance.  State requests a warrant and note he had conversations with Mr. Wittig regarding a DAGPA but do not know why he doesn't appear.  State asks to have until Friday to attempt to reach him.  Court will authorize a warrant and defer signing it until noon on Friday.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:59 PM Defendant Derrick A. Wittig appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Mr. Wittig wishes to represent himself and time to speak with the DA.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
